author: monra_1328
content: do you believe that blockchain gaming will gain more traction?

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Quote from: monra_1328 on September 10, 2022, 11:44:42 AMdo you believe that blockchain gaming will gain more traction?It will and most definitely. comments.author: Imran232
comments.body: Why not? I actually believed that blockchain gaming would boom. Why? Because blockchain is decentralized, and we know that decentralization is more secure than centralization. So if people got more security and more control over their profiles, then why wouldn't gamers choose blockchain games? Now if they choose to play blockchain games, then obviously the blockchain gaming industry will boom. Look around, everyone is playing games not only because they want to, they also play for a long time to earn money. But in blockchain games, it is already built on the concept of earning. So obviously, it has so much potential. Now we just need some great games. Games should be entertaining. You shouldn't be bored. That's my overall opinion. Thank you.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: The crypto gaming industry has a great chance to grow a lot in the future. In 2021, the GameFi and Play-2-Earn projects showed impressive growth and gathered a large community. The main problem with these projects is that they sometimes have poor tokenomics and very little utility when the project interacts with some NFT tokens. The community doesn't see much utility in that, so projects have liquidity circulation problems. Players take more money out of the project than they contribute or at least reinvest. This causes the price of tokens to drop very quickly and interest among the core community to disappear. The industry is still at the very beginning of adopting.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: monra_1328 on September 10, 2022, 11:44:42 AMdo you believe that blockchain gaming will gain more traction?Yes.We're already seeing it but it's just like labeling the game as it's a "blockchain-based" game. But in reality, these games are just like the same and the new trend might just be that it's changed because there's a sort of reward such as real money which we've seen in NFT games. Also, virtual reality or the Metaverse is likely what is this blockchain gaming all about. Certain changes could be there but in the next years, we might see another type of trend for these games again.

comments.author: Iron Fist
comments.body: Blockchain has so much potentials to make the gaming industry, and other industries, flourish. The best things about blockchain are, it's secure, decentralized and transparent. But blockchain gaming is still in its early days, but the future of this emerging field seems to be extremely promising. Many popular traditional games are being ported to the blockchain, with potentially more to come. And blockchain gaming doesn't seem to be going away anytime soon. Now, imagine that we're in 5 years time. I have no idea how blockchain gaming will evolve today, but one thing is sure: there are many players in the game world and they will definitely grow in the near future.

comments.author: TopTort777
comments.body: I see no big future for blockchain gaming. People are oversaturated with current games. Regular gaming industry does not keep up with the wishes of the players. Devs spend millions and years creating gaming. Gamers spend weeks and months and switch for other project. Blockchain gaming is something long lasting imho. Gamers are like gamblers, they need everything now or yesterday. They want to play and have fun, but not struggle doing calculations of tokens, trades, value and etc, and learning what is blockchain and etc. Even now, metaverse - game involved innovation, is not very demanded. We see lots of projects, but I dont see any real and deep interest in them.

comments.author: Gayong88
comments.body: When you look at the future of blockchain gaming, it looks very bright. While there is a lot of development and testing that still needs to be done in the years to come, there are strong indications that the potential is enormous, and is growing. Good times lie ahead!In my opinion blockchain will work on cross-platform capabilities. I believe that players from all over the world will have the ability to connect with each other, whether they are mobile gamers or computer gamers. Blockchain currently has a limited number of users, but as it grows and more people get into blockchain development, I think they can make a lot of amazing games to attract more audience.
